RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 63. Claiming Purse 21800. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since March 7 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000, if for $12,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CHIPPEWA'S CASTLE raced with the early pace inside but dropped back and eased out into the backstretch and settled close, started a bid approaching the three eighths pole, took the lead three wide nearing the five sixteenths, contested the edge nearest the rail on the far turn, dueled clear mid-stretch and held on well. STROLLINGINTHEWIND saved ground on the first turn, started a four wide bid leaving the half mile pole and contested at a close disadvantage two deep on the far turn and remained a factor through the upper stretch before relenting. S S ALASKAN CRUZ saved ground on the first turn, bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole and raced near the rail on the far turn, angled out into the lane and finished evenly to take third inside the sixteenth pole. ORANGEBURG raced with the early pace two deep while between horses, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole then flattened inside the eighth. NICE BUT NAUGHTY settled inside on the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced near the rail on the far turn and weakened in the lane. RED HOT TODDY stumbled at the break and rounded the first turn two deep, showed little response through the backstretch and raced in the five path of the far turn. HILLBILLY ROCK settled two deep on the opening turn, gave chase into the backstretch then weakened in the four path of the far turn. TWO ROOM SCHOOL tapered in and raced with the early pace, took a brief lead three wide at the nine sixteenths pole but gave up the advantage approaching the five sixteenths and weakened in the four path of the far turn. The Stewards reviewed then dismissed a claim of foul for alleged interference on the far turn, lodged by the rider of Orangeburg, against the rider of Chippewa's Castle.

ENTRY.NAME: Chippewa's Castle
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Law Legacy Stables LLC & Ronney W. Brown

ENTRY.NAME: Strollinginthewind
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,4wd bid past 1/2,close 2d far turn,relented 1/16

ENTRY.NAME: Red Hot Toddy
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled break,2d 1st turn,little response,5p far turn

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 53. Claiming Purse 13300. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since March 7 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: REAL APPEAL chased inside and raced close at the rail on the turn, took the lead between horses leaving the turn and drew off under steady handling. I SHALLBE RELEASED gave chase through the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn then dueled through the stretch and took the nod for second under the wire. POWER SONDE gave chase, raced off the rail on the turn and was outfinished in the stretch duel for second. LET'S DO THIS chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the five path and was outfinished in the duel through the stretch. JACKYSINTHECASTLE chased inside, raced near the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. DEREKA'S BLUFF chased then flattened in the four path on the turn. A BLONDE THING gave only distant chase and rounded the turn in the four and five paths. MARLEESBEEBEE pressured the pace and raced close through the turn, but drifted approaching the eighth pole and weakened in the lane. VEGAS PRINCESS was hustled to the lead and set a pressured pace past the half mile pole, raced with the edge nearest the rail on the turn, gave up the lead leaving the turn and gave way in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Real Appeal
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside,close rail turn,up between 1/8,drew off driving

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 76. Claiming Purse 9700. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE APRIL 7, 2022. Weight, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 7, 2022 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000 (W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: AWESOME BEACH pressured the pace and took the nod two deep at the quarter pole, dug in under steady encouragement leaving the turn and just lasted. BIG HAMBONE chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn off the rail, drifted into the lane but dug in under steady handling and just missed. BETTER BOOGIE set a pressured pace through the backstretch, was met at the rail at the quarter pole, remained close through the turn then flattened inside the eighth pole. GAMING JACK chased through the backstretch, angled out midway on the turn, entered the stretch about the six path and passed rivals widest. WARRIOR'S ESTATE gave chase outside, raced in the five path of the turn then flattened in the lane. BARRY KARAFIN BETS chased, raced off the rail on the turn and weakened in the lane. BUCKED TOOTH saved ground. SHACKLED gave chase, rounded the turn about the four path and showed little in the lane. BARNSTORM angled out and gave chase, though never factored.

ENTRY.NAME: Gaming Jack
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,angled out mid turn,6p 1/8,passed rivals widest

ENTRY.NAME: Barnstorm
ENTRY.OWNER: Sperling Nancie S and Racanelli Mark Joseph

ENTRY.NAME: Awesome Beach
ENTRY.OWNER: Prostar 10 Stables Inc and The Four Horsemen Racing Stable Inc

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 56. Maiden Special Weight Purse 32700. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES THREE YEARS OLD. Weight, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LOVE OF GRACE ducked in and hit the gate at the break then settled off the rail on the first turn, started a bid approaching the five sixteenths pole, raced close off the rail on the far turn, took the lead past the eighth pole and dug in determinedly to eke out the nod over the game effort of JUBASLILBALLERINA, who stalked from the three path and challenged at the three eighths pole, took the lead two deep approaching the quarter, raced clear midway on the far turn, was met past the eighth pole but dug in gamely to the finish. SNEAKY LYNK rounded the first turn in the four path, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole, raced in the four path on the far turn and finished evenly at the outside flank of the runner-up. S S FRONTIER ANGEL saved ground, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn in the three path and ran evenly down the lane. SMOKIN LADY raced with the pace through the front stretch and moved to even terms leaving the half mile pole, took the nod at the seven sixteenths, came under pressure toward the three eighths but was met at the rail at the quarter pole, dropped back midway on the far turn and flattened in the lane. ODINA rated close inside on the first turn, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail and showed little further. CLOUD MOVER rounded the first turn in the four path and showed little response through the backstretch. JUST HAVE FAITH hesitated at the break and saved ground. S S CASINO GIRL raced with the pace inside through the front stretch, was met leaving the half mile pole and gave chase from that point but gave way approaching the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Odina
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close inside,chased 7/16,off rail far turn,empty lane

ENTRY.NAME: S S Casino Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: with pace inside,up 5/8,met 1/2,chased,gave way near far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Smokin Lady
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 59. Claiming Purse 14500. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since March 7 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SISTER'S DUTY chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the four path, dueled for the lead mid-stretch and edged clear later yards. K K CAN bobbled and was bumped outward and into Bet The Queen leaving the gate, picked up the chase inside, raced at the rail on the turn then outfinished in the duel through the stretch. MI YAYIS was forced outward and into K K Can leaving the gate, gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn two deep and came along for third later yards. R LOVE ON THE RUN ducked outward and into My Yayis leaving the gate then set a pressured pace from the half mile pole, rounded the tur at the rail, was met mid-stretch and flattened the final sixteenth. BET THE QUEEN was bumped leaving the gate, raced well back early, rounded the turn about the three path and finished evenly to pass rivals. GRAM'S GAL saved ground. GOSSIPING broke a step slow and never factored. SHANIA SEA pressured the pace through the backstretch then faded off the rail approaching the top of the lane. QUEEN OF KANTHAROS ducked out leaving the gate, gave chase through the backstretch but weakened on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Mi Yayis
ENTRY.COMMENT: forced out,bumped break,chased,2d turn,along 3rd later yards

ENTRY.NAME: Shania Sea
ENTRY.OWNER: Two Ten Twelve Triple T Racing

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 43. Maiden Special Weight Purse 32700. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 116 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BOSES MADCHEN chased through the backstretch, raced close off the rail on the turn, dueled to the front toward mid-stretch and edged clear later yards. PHANTOM QUEEN took over leaving the chute and set a clear pace inside, came under pressure at the quarter pole, rounded the turn near the rail, was met toward mid-stretch and relented later yards. SHEWEARSSTILETTOS chased inside through the backstretch, rounded the turn near the rail, angled out approaching the top of the lane and continued in an outward drift through the lane. FAR MORE chased through the backstretch, raced in the five path of the turn and ran evenly in the lane. TAPTAP chased, raced near the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. LADY ALDRIN gave chase, raced off the rail on the turn and flattened in the lane. KNOBIESMAGICSONDE gave chase, rounded the turn about the seven path and showed little in the lane. LAURA'S GRAND chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn near the rail and weakened. LADY GANGSTER stumbled to her nose at the break, picked up the chase outside then flattened in the three path of the turn. OWLHOOT saved ground.

ENTRY.NAME: Shewearsstilettos
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside,rail turn,angled out 1/8,drifted lane,wide at wire

ENTRY.NAME: Boses Madchen
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,close off rail turn,up near 1/16,edged clear later yards

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 7F Dirt CR: 81. Claiming Purse 16900. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE OCTOBER 7, 2022 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Weight, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Since October 7 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ROYAL CRUSADER was unprepared for the break and shuffled back after the start, rounded the first turn off the rail, bid past the seven sixteenths pole, steadily improved at the rail on the far turn and dug in for the lead mid-stretch. TWEET THIS settled off the pace inside on the first turn, picked up the chase toward the seven sixteenths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn, eased out approaching the eighth pole, finished well to take second later yards and was gaining on the winner. ONE MORE FACTOR set the pace inside, came under pressure leaving the three eighths pole and raced near the rail on the far turn, was met mid-stretch then flattened later yards. HEARTNESS stalked the earlier pace from the three path, picked up the chase toward the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail then flattened inside the eighth pole. FUTILE raced well off the early pace in the three path, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail and finished well. SAN ANTONE saved ground, picked up the chase past the half mile pole, rounded the far turn near the rail and flattened in the lane. JAMMIN STILL rounded the first turn in the four and five paths, showed little response through the backstretch and raced in the seven path of the far turn. ELVIRUS rounded the first turn about the three path, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole but flattened in the five path of the far turn. CHARITABLE SPENNY ducked out at the break then stalked two deep, gave chase into the backstretch, rounded the far turn in the five path and weakened. MINE TO HOLD saved ground.

ENTRY.NAME: Futile
ENTRY.OWNER: FGF Stables and Come What May Racing

ENTRY.NAME: Heartness
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3p 1st turn,chased 3/8,off rail far turn,flattened lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 90. Allowance Purse 33900. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since Marc h 7 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since February 7 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: AMIDSHIPS set a pressured pace from the half mile pole, rounded the turn near the rail and was steadily handled through the lane. ROCKET APPEAL pressured the winner, raced close off the rail on the turn and finished well at that ones outside girth. FIBER STRONG chased, raced close in the three path of the turn and ran evenly in the lane. DAN THE MAN CAN gave chase through the backstretch, raced at the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. SHOWTIME CAT chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn in the three path then flattened in the lane. SO COURAGEOUS chased inside, raced near the rail on the turn and showed little in the lane. KIDMAN KERRY engaged in close early chase but weakened in the four path of the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Amidships
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,rail turn,steady handling lane

ENTRY.NAME: Dan the Man Can
ENTRY.OWNER: A and B Racing Stable LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Rocket Appeal
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace,close off rail turn,finished well

ENTRY.NAME: Fiber Strong
ENTRY.OWNER: Pascal Lawrence J and Harding Sr Philip Arthur

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 9 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 89. Claiming Purse 15700. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE OCTOBER 7, 2022. Weight, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 7 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considere d In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MOJAC KAT gave chase, raced at the rail on the turn and dueled to the front mid-stretch, drew clear later yards and held on well. GRUMPELSTILTSKIN chased outside, rounded the turn in the four path and finished well to take second later yards. NO FOOLING DUDE chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn in the four path and finished well. MAJESTIC SEAS pressured the pace inside, took the nod at the rail midway on the turn, raced clear into the lane but flattened the final sixteenth. WIDGET FACTORY chased the early pace toward the inside, angled to the eight path on the turn and passed rivals. BERHANU gave chase, raced in the two and three paths on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. FIT BUT FAT gave chase inside, lacked room at the rail approaching the top of the lane and flattened stride. FIRST NAVY ADMIRAL was hustled to a slim lead approaching the five sixteenths pole, gave up the edge two deep midway on the turn, dropped back into the lane and weakened. IMPETUOUS set the early pace but was met approaching the five sixteenths pole and weakened in the five path of the turn. TANELEER was never a factor and angled widest into the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Majestic Seas
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace,up rail mid turn,clear lane,flattened 1/16

ENTRY.NAME: No Fooling Dude
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Ronney W and Conrad Randall R
